DataElement.preferredName: Patient Personal Medical History Investigational Treatment Regimen Interference Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded indicator as to whether or not the patient's medical background may interfere with the assessments of the investigational treatment plan as outlined in the eligibility criteria of the study protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Personal Medical History Investigational Treatment Regimen Interference Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies._In the process of being studied; experimental._A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment._The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Personal Medical History Investigational Treatment Regimen Interference Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.:In the process of being studied; experimental.:A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.:The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.
In the process of being studied; experimental.
A treatment plan that specifies the dosage, the schedule, and the duration of treatment.
The act of hindering or obstructing or impeding.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does patient have a prior or
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen (required for phase 1 portion, but not the phase 2 or non-BRD4 exploratory cohort)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior malignancy whose natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a prior malignancy the natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen, are eligible with permission from the principle investigator?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior (or concurrent for Phase I) malignancy whose natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: If the patient has a prior or concurrent malignancy, is the malignancy's natural history or treatment such that it does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen such as carcinoma in situ or low-grade prostate carcinoma?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen for this trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 8
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior or concurrent invasive malignancy whose natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 9
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment that has the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen (required for phase 1 portion, but not the phase 2 or non-BRD4 exploratory cohort)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a prior or concurrent malignancy, the natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen for this trial?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 11
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a prior or concurrent malignancy, the natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment has the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regiment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 12
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen (e.g., basal cell carcinoma, early-stage differentiated thyroid carcinoma, low-risk prostate cancer, ductal carcinoma in situ of the breast, squamous cell carcinoma of the skin that has undergone potentially curative therapy, in situ cervical cancer)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ECOG-ACRIN - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have prior or concurrent malignancy whose natural history or treatment has the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 13
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has a prior or concurrent malignancy, the natural history or treatment does not have the potential to interfere with the safety or efficacy assessment of the investigational regimen?
